diff_act: 3.notify the user that the request has been queued
4.remove the unit from the list of running units
6.generate a request to turn on the next unit in the queue

regen.absent_element: determining the maximum number of heating or cooling units that can run simultaneously
regen.new_specification: The THEMAS system shall define and maintain a configuration parameter to limit the maximum number of heating or cooling units that may be running at any given time.

regen.absent_element: notification when a unit is turned on from the queue
regen.new_specification: The system shall notify the user when a unit is turned on from the queue.

regen.absent_element: removal of a unit from the queue when it is turned on
regen.new_specification: The system shall remove the unit from the LIFO queue when the request to turn on the unit is honored and the unit is actually turned on.

label: When a request to turn off a heating or cooling unit is received, this process shall first check the LIFO queue and remove the unit-turn-on request from the queue if exists.
absence: action of checking the queue and removing the unit-turn-on request if exists when a request to turn off a unit is received
